title: How to use my own caption files, like .txt file when training
body: How to use my own caption files, instead of using default
author: Nomination-NRB

comments.body: just place the txt-files with the same name as the image in the input-folder (the folder of the images)

> just place the txt-files with the same name as the image in the input-folder (the folder of the images)

Thanks for you reply!

title: question about image caption file types
body:
Hello,

I was looking at the args.json file for some comparison and troubleshooting and saw this line:
 
 _"caption_extension": ".caption",_

In my dataset, my images are tagged with a identically named _.txt_ . Does this line mean that I have inadvertently been training without image captions at all?

If so, how should I address this problem? Change my picture captions to _.caption_ or is there a setting that I need to change?

Thanks
author: enkie358

comments.body:
This actually confused me too initially, there is a global `caption_extension` argument, and then dataset specific `caption_extension` argument. Since the beginning I've used the dataset specific argument and hard coded it as .txt

Later someone pointed this out as they realised their .caption -files were never used, and I've since added the option to set the desired extension to the very first dataset node, still defaulting to .txt.

So in your case there's no need to worry, .txt has always worked. I've also added a console log line that states how many captions were loaded.
okay thank you for that clarification!

title: How to train more optimization steps?
body:
Hi,

I had a quick question, I noticed that changing the number of repeats, or number of datasets the overall optimization steps appears to remain the same (3000). 

If I wanted to train a lora for longer (more overall optimization steps), what would be the best way to go about it?
author: enkie358

comments.body: You just increase the max_train_steps, everything is currently calculated by that.
